variable.name: F44VY
variable.comment: Visit year (follow-up visits) or number (baseline visits) for which this form was collected.

variable.name: MEDSEQ
variable.description: F44 Medication sequence id within visit

variable.name: MEDNDC
variable.comment: A description of a medication can be found in the reference file f44ref_meds.dat by merging on the MEDNDC variable. A list of ingredients contained in a medication can be found in the reference file f44ref_med_ingreds.dat by merging on the MEDNDC variable.

value.code: A description of the medication represented by the

variable.value: A description of the medication represented by the NDC can be found in the reference file f44ref_meds.dat by merging on the MEDNDC variable

variable.name: ADULTDY
variable.description: F44 Adult duration of medication use (days)
variable.comment: Duration (days) of medication use starting at age 20.

variable.name: ADULTY
variable.description: F44 Adult duration of medication use (years)
variable.comment: Duration (years) of medication use starting at age 20.

variable.name: CORT
variable.description: F44 Oral daily use of a glucocorticosteroid
variable.comment: If participant was using a medication in the Corticosteroid (220000s) Therapeutic Class, indicates if the medication was a glucocorticosteroid taken orally and daily.

variable.name: TCCODE
variable.comment:
A description of a medication therapeutic class can be found in the reference file f44ref_med_classes.dat by merging on the TCCODE variable.

The first 2 digits of the Therapeutic Class Code represent the Drug Group. The next 2 digits represent the Drug Class within the Drug Group. The last 2 digits represent the Drug Subclass within the Drug Class.

Example
--------------
Drug Group:
270000 Antidiabetic
Drug Class:
271000 Insulin
Drug Subclass:
271010 Mixed Insulin
271020 Beef Insulin
271030 Pork Insulin
271040 Human Insulin

value.code: A description of the medication therapeutic class

variable.value: A description of the medication therapeutic class represented by the TCCODE can be found in the reference file f44ref_med_classes.dat by merging on the TCCODE variable
